creator: jan.pernica@brain-systems.com
text:
in the version 0.20.3rc we have used external graphics like this:
<fo:external-graphic content-height="auto" content-width="auto" height="auto" 
width="auto" src="figures/Model-DMS_cad.png"/>
the fo file is stored in the directory c:/temp
the image file exists

In the version 0.20.3rc2 it does not work:
[ERROR]: Error while creating area : Error creating FopImage object (Error creat
ing FopImage object (file:/E:/temp/analyzy/wf/figures/WF-Administrace_ucd.png) :
 org.apache.fop.image.JimiImage

creator: caugustin@alcyonis.fr
text:
Created attachment 1335
Attachement include a xml exemple, a xsl exemple for version 0.20.2 and 0.20.3 and 2 images (gif and png)

PNG images where supported in version 0.20.2 but not anymore in version 0.20.3
(any  release).

We are using fop to build PDF file from a xml and a xsl file. 

The test was made with binary distribution and source file recompiled of fop
0.20.3. Both tests have beed done on a Linux box (Red hat 7.2 Enigma) and
Windows 2000 with java 1.2.2 and 1.3.1.

The test with fop binary 0.20.2 have been done on a Windows 2000 box with java
1.3.1.

I send an attached zip file (simple_test.zip) to test.

Cedric.
creator: caugustin@alcyonis.fr

text:
According to Bug 6691 and after test, the version 0.20.3rc (Jan 19th) work fine
with PNG images as version 0.20.3rc2 and 0.20.3 don't.
creator: caugustin@alcyonis.fr
j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text:
The Jimi image library is no longer distributed by default
with FOP because of license problems. You'll have to install
it yourself, look into the documentation provided with the
FOP distribution.
*** Bug 6691 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text: *** Bug 6881 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: big_eugene@mail.ru
text:
I have to put PNG images into PDF file.
I belive I'm not only one.

Is it possible to include support of PNG images into the next version?

Regards

Please read http://xml.apache.org/fop/relnotes.html. It will tell you that the 
Jimi image library has been taken out of the FOP distribution because of 
license reasons. That does not mean we don't have any PNG support anymore. It's 
still there. Please read the release notes and follow the instructions there.
creator: jeremias.maerki@outline.ch
